title: Everyone complaining about Ahri but Lucian 53% Winrate 51% Pickrate?
body:
I don't care if {{champion:236}}  has been a bad pick for a while, he's way too good right now. Who would have thought that buffing him over and over again along with his keystone and on-hit items would have lead to this? Not to mention he's easy as fuck to play.

Source: https://www.op.gg/champion/statistics

EDIT: I'm not saying Ahri isn't too good right now. Fuck Ahri.

in the end ct isn't the reason lucian is broken now

Except its not just out-trading, he's doing so much early game damage that if his support throws in any kinda damage to go with him, he's sending your ass back to fountain.

You're right, botrk is what is making Lucian stronger right now. I worry about people complaining about champions being strong when what has made them strong isn't the champion itself, but the item.

Take lethality for example, it broke champions, but people were crying for nerfs to a bunch of them instead of looking at lethality as the problem.

but how many champions has botrk really broken? I can only think of a few, unlike lethality which broke an entire class of champions

perhaps I'm mistaken though, but I don't see botrk being broken on any more than like, 3 or 4 champs
Personally i am seeing A LOT of people building bork, on like everything

That is a fair point, perhaps I was mistaken and Lucian does need to be looked at.

I hope RIOT is careful about changes they make though. I just got the Project Skin from a loot chest and started playing him right as the botrk changes came out, making him too strong.

I think Lucian is fun, not because of his strength, but because of his theme.

By all means, please nerf him - just please don't make him unplayable!

I wouldn't mind a nerf to Lucian either, but Lucian is very hit or miss for metas. Especially for the adc class, where it tends to be 2-3 op adcs that utilize the items better than the rest, so nerfing lucian has 2 chances of putting him out of meta because of how finicky his kit is to balance :(

Both are oppressive when strong and abuse both forms of ADC builds, they simply have different strengths. Lucian can't root you from two screens away and kill you in two autos, and Jhin can't perma-kite almost as good as Kalista. 

Nice favoritism though
Yeah but Jhin is overall more fun to play against at least since you can dodge his stuff without a mobility spell.

Jhin might be a little strong right now but:

* 2.5 second reload
* Worst duelist, easily killed if caught out
* W and R are easily dodgeable
Saying Jhin's W is hard to hit is like Saying Lux's Ult is hard to hit.

Considering they have similar delays and one is substantially smaller than the other I would say that Jhin's is far harder to hit.  Pretty sure it is one of those abilities that you can technically always dodge if you aren't being cc'd/pinned against a wall.  It is just a matter of reaction times and chaining it with slows.

Jhin's delay is significantly smaller then Lux's ultimate, not too mention it's almost always used in conjunction with CC, such as Slows etc. 
Neither are particular hard to hit.

* During which time he can cast spells, freely kite + reposition. Even Riot admits that the reload mechanic can actually be a boon, so stop citing that as a weakness. It 'hurts' his DPS only in the sense that he isn't attacking 2.5 times a second like a Jinx or a Twtich, but he isn't actually suffering a net loss of damage in a real fight. http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2017/02/dev-on-the-champs-of-2016/

* Jhin duels just fine, he has great kiting and plenty of options to pressure. ADCs are fucking meant to die when caught out, and Jhin is no different. That's like saying a squishy artillery mage dies when CCed.

* Sure, but considering the W has massive range and is usually used in conjunction with allied CC (same with ult, which synergizes with Jhin's W), it actually isn't very hard to hit. If you use W in melee range then you deserve to get fucked, but otherwise it's not difficult to land in the slighest. Once you land one shot with ult, unless they have obnoxious mobility, it's pretty straightforward to land the rest, especially if your team is there.
Why can't Lucian's kit be balanced?

The only reason why lucian has such a high play rate is because he's literally the most fun adc to play - I mean who doesn't want to play a guy with 2 guns going pew pew?
It has more to do with the fact that he's a busted piece of shit right now TBH.
He's fun to play when he's trash too

Yes, his pickrate stems from "fun", that's why it's up over 6 fold on KR since patch 7.4 and over 4 fold on NA.

I was responding to this

>The only reason why lucian has such a high play rate is because he's literally the most fun adc to play

Which is utter bullshit. If his pickrate was purely due to "fun" as suggested it would be odd to see his playrate spike by ~5x when he got his buff, wouldn't it?

His playrate has spiked because he's an absurd champion right now, nothing about him is balanced and he needs some fairly harsh nerfs ASAP.

His play rate was over 10% when he was "trash"  a few patches ago. If we assume that the other pickrates were more-or-less the same then, that means that he'd be in the top 25 most played Champion+Roles in the game, and one of the top 6 most played ADCs.

So yeah, if a champion has a 47% win rate and a 10% pick rate they're probably being picked because they're fun. For comparison, Jinx was sporting a 6.5% play rate and 50.86% win rate at the same time, so if people only cared about winning there'd be more people playing Jinx than Lucian. I doubt the 3.5% play rate difference was enough to lower the win rate on Lucian 3.5%.

--------

It doesn't take a genius to imagine what happens when a champion is fun *and* OP - of course their pick rate goes through the roof. But I don't think that discredits DJ Lucio's statement that Lucian is fun.

No it's because he is utterly broken. 
Look at ANY adc main from ANY elo nearlynone of them will have only one or two adcs they play. 
They ALWAYS pick the currently most broken. 
Jinx first with 25% pickrate, then cait, varus, jhin and now back to lucian.
don't worry, riot is gonna fix this in 5 to 6 months!
